caption.title: The YXXM motif in SFV nsP3 mediates PI3K/AKT hyperactivation.
caption.p: A. AKT activation in BHK cells infected at MOI 10 as indicated and lysed at 8 hpi, together with densitometry of phosphorylated AKT (S473), normalised to total AKT signals and relative to mock-infected cells (mean of three independent experiments ± SEM). B. Immunofluorescence showing activation of AKT (S473, green) in MEFs transfected for 24 h with the indicated DNA plasmids (red: FLAG-nsP3, blue: nuclei). Representative epifluorescence images are shown. Scale bar: 20 μm. Co-immunoprecipitations showing the interaction between EYFP-p85−α ( C and E) or EYFP-p85−β ( D) in HEK293T cells transfected with the indicated constructs for 24 h. EYFP-tagged p85 constructs were immunoprecipitated with an anti-GFP antibody. BAP: biotin acceptor peptide, Myr-Pal: myristoylation and palmitoylation. F. Interaction of endogenous p85 and viral nsP3 in lysates of BHK cells infected at MOI 10 for 8 h, after immunoprecipitation with an anti-p85 antibody. Growth curves of SFV-wt and SFV-YF in BHK cells infected at MOI 0.1 ( G) or 10 ( H) for the indicated times. Virus titres at each time point were determined by plaque assay. Data show the mean ± SEM of three experiments.
